medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Patient 1 had a 10-year history of breathlessness that initially occurred while training a youth football team. By 2003, he was unable to run and had stopped working due to breathlessness. Patient 2 had a 15-year history of breathlessness that necessitated stopping work. Both patients experienced a steady decline in lung function over years.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Patient 1 had no regular medication, never smoked, and demonstrated typical centriacinar emphysema with mild airway obstruction. Patient 2 also had similar lung function findings and was a lifelong non-smoker. Both had significant lung function deterioration.
medical_history.family_history: Father died of ischaemic heart disease and emphysema at age 67. Both patients are brothers, suggesting a potential genetic component to their conditions.
medical_history.social_history: Both patients were exposed occupationally to cadmium fumes with significant exposures during their work as furnace men and window fitters. None were smokers.
